recipient_setup_h.intro_Txt: Recipient Setup page facilitates set up of different types of recipients depending on user's needs.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt1: Provide the following information to setup an FTP server as a recipient:
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the FTP server.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt4: Network address - Enter the server's IP address or host name. Note that a DNS server must be specified in the TCP/IP network settings if using a host name.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt5: Upload path - Specify the path to the directory where the uploaded images will be stored. If this directory does not already exist on the FTP server, there will be an error message when uploading.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt6: Port number - Enter the port number used by the FTP server. The default is 21.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt7: User name/Password - Provide the login information for the FTP server.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt8: Use passive mode - Under normal circumstances the product simply requests the target FTP server to open the data connection. Checking this box issues a PASV command to the FTP server to establish a passive FTP connection. The product actively initiates both the FTP control and data connections to the target server. This is normally needed if there is a firewall between the product and the target FTP server.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt9: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.fTP_Txt10: Use temporary mode - Under normal circumstances the product simply requests the target FTP server to open the data connection. Checking this box issues a command to the FTP server to create a temporary file in FTP connection and then renames it to the original file name.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt1: Provide the following information to setup an SFTP server as a recipient:
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the SFTP server.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt4: Network address - Enter the server's IP address or host name. Note that a DNS server must be specified in the TCP/IP network settings if using a host name.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt5: Upload path - Specify the path to the directory where the uploaded images will be stored. If this directory does not already exist on the SFTP server, there will be an error message when uploading.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt6: Port number - Enter the port number used by the SFTP server. The default is 22.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt7: User name/Password - Provide the login information for the SFTP server.
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt8: Public key MD5 - The fingerprint of the remote host's public key (a 32 hexadecimal digits string).
recipient_setup_h.sFTP_Txt9: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt1: Provide the following information to setup an HTTP server as a recipient:
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the HTTP server.
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt4: URL - Enter the network address to the HTTP server and the script that will handle the request. For example: http://192.168.254.10/cgi-bin/notify.cgi
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt5: User name/Password - Provide the login information for the HTTP server.
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt6: Proxy settings - If it is a must to pass a proxy server to connect to the HTTP server, check the Proxy settings box and enter:
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt8: Port number - The number of the port used for access.
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt9: User name/Password - If a user name and password is needed for the proxy server, enter these here.
recipient_setup_h.hTTP_Txt10: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt1: Provide the following information to setup an HTTPS server as a recipient:
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the HTTPS server.
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt4: URL - Enter the network address to the HTTPS server and the script that will handle the request. For example: https://192.168.254.10/cgi-bin/notify.cgi
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt6: Validate server certificate - Check this box to validate the certificate that was created by HTTPS server.
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt7: Proxy settings - If it is a must to pass a proxy server to connect to the HTTPS server, check the Proxy settings box and enter:
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt9: Port number - Enter the number of the port used for access.
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt10: User name/Password - If a user name and password is needed for the proxy server, enter these here.
recipient_setup_h.hTTPS_Txt11: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt1: Network share allows you to add network storage such as a NAS (Network Attached Storage) and use it as a recipient to store recordings. The files are stored as Matroska (MKV) file format. Provide the following information to setup a Network Share as a recipient:
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the Network Share.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt3: Type - Select Network Share from the drop-down list.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt4: Network address - Enter the IP adress or Host name for the Network Share.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt5: Share - Enter the name of the share on the host.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt6: Upload path - Specify the path to the directory where the uploaded images or recordings will be stored.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt7: User name/Password - Provide login information for the Network Share.
recipient_setup_h.networkShare_Txt8: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt1: Triggers the Action Rule for the product to send images, video clips and notifications through email. Enter the following information for the email:
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the email recipient.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt4: To - Enter the email address(es) to send emails to. In case it is needed to send to more than one address, use comma to separate email addresses.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt5: Provider - From the drop-down list, choose email provider for example Gmail, Yahoo etc.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt6: User id/Password - Provide login information for the email recipient server. Leave this field empty if the email server does not need authentication.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt7: Advanced settings - This setting is important for setting your own email server by choosing the option User defined in the Provider option above.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt8: From email - Enter the email address of the sending server.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt9: SMTP Server - Enter the name of the SMTP server for example, smtp.gmail.com, smtp.mail.yahoo.com
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt10: Port - Enter the port number for the SMTP server, using values in the range 0-65535. The default value is 587.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt14: Server - Enter the name of the POP server for example, pop.gmail.com
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt15: User name/Password - Provide login information for the SMTP server.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt16: Encryption - If not using encryption select None, to use encryption select either TLS or SSL.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt17: Validate server certificate - check this box to validate the identity of the Axis product. The certificate can be self-signed or issued by a Certificate Authority (CA). For more on how certificates can be used, see System Options > Certificates.
recipient_setup_h.email_Txt18: The connection can be tested by clicking Test.
recipient_setup_h.emailSendLimit_Txt: Note: Some email providers have security filters that prevent users from receiving or viewing large amount of attachments, from receiving scheduled emails and similar. Check the email provider's security policy to avoid your email account being locked or missing on your expected emails.
recipient_setup_h.tCP_Txt1: Sends a notification to a TCP notification server that listens for messages. Provide the following information:
recipient_setup_h.tCP_Txt2: Name - Enter a descriptive name for the TCP server.
recipient_setup_h.tCP_Txt4: Network address - Enter the notification server's host name or IP address. Note that a DNS server must be specified in the TCP/IP network setting if using a host name.
recipient_setup_h.tCP_Txt5: Port number - Enter the port number used to access the server.
recipient_setup_h.tCP_Txt6: When the setup is complete, the connection can be tested by clicking Test.

recipients_h.intro_Txt1: Recipients FTP, HTTP, HTTPS, Network Share, Email and TCP servers are used to receive uploaded image files, video clips and notification messages.
recipients_h.intro_Txt3: HTTP server - Receives notification messages, uploaded images and video clips
recipients_h.intro_Txt4: HTTPS server - Receives uploaded images and video clips
recipients_h.intro_Txt5: Network share - Receives images and video clips
recipients_h.intro_Txt6: Email - Stores e-mail addresses for notifications or sending images
recipients_h.list_Txt1: The list on this page shows all of the recipients currently configured. The following information is provided:
recipients_h.list_Txt2: Name - The name that was entered when server was set up.
recipients_h.list_Txt3: Type - FTP, HTTP, HTTPS, Network Share, Email or TCP.
recipients_h.list_Txt4: Address - Depending on the type of recipient server, the address column may contain details such as IP, Host name, URL address or email address.
recipients_h.list_Txt5: Upload path - Lists the images upload path for FTP servers and Network Share.
recipients_h.list_Txt6: User name - Shows the user name used by the server.
recipients_h.buttons_Txt: To add a new recipient click Add. To view an existing recipient select it and click View. To create a new recipient from an existing one select it and click Copy. To delete a recipient select it and click Remove.
recipients_h.modify_note: Note: Deleting a recipient will not affect existing action rules using that recipient. The settings of the deleted recipient are stored in the action rule. To change the recipient settings in the action rule, select an existing recipient in the Action Rule List or create a new recipient in the Action Rule Setup page.
recipients_h.recipientsetup_link: See Recipient Setup for more information on how to set Recipients.
